required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multimodal Analgesia With Acetaminophen vs. Narcotics Alone After Hip Arthroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Multimodal Analgesia With Acetaminophen vs. Narcotics Alone After Hip Arthroscopy

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this proposed study is to evaluate the efficacy of a multimodal approach to analgesia for patient's pain after hip arthroscopy and to also assess if this new approach will result in a reduction in post-operative narcotic use.
This study is a single-center, randomized prospective study comparing post-operative pain scores and narcotic consumption between individuals receiving acetaminophen along with a reduced quantity of Percocet (to be used as needed for breakthrough pain) and individuals receiving Percocet only. Both pain management options are considered to be standard of care. Both cohorts will receive aspirin for DVT prophylaxis and celecoxib for heterotopic ossification prophylaxis.
The primary objective of the study are to compare patients' narcotic consumption and reported pain following arthroscopic hip surgery, and determine if acetaminophen can provide adequate pain relief compared to a narcotic medication.

primary_outcome.description: Satisfaction was reported on a Likert-type scale of 1-10 (the higher the score, the higher the satisfaction)
Amount of oxycodone/acetaminophen (Percocet) in 5mg/325mg doses will be recorded in number of pills

primary_outcome.measure: Score on Visual Analog Scale (VAS) of Pain
primary_outcome.description: Pain severity scores at rest will be assessed by use of VAS. The visual analog scale (VAS) is a validated, subjective measure for acute and chronic pain. Scores are recorded by making a handwritten mark on a 10-cm line that represents a continuum between "no pain" and "worst pain." The higher the score, the worse the pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Score on Visual Analog Scale (VAS) of Pain
primary_outcome.description: Pain severity scores at rest will be assessed by use of VAS. The visual analog scale (VAS) is a validated, subjective measure for acute and chronic pain. Scores are recorded by making a handwritten mark on a 10-cm line that represents a continuum between "no pain" and "worst pain." The higher the score, the worse the pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Score on Visual Analog Scale (VAS) of Pain
primary_outcome.description: Pain severity scores at rest will be assessed by use of VAS. The visual analog scale (VAS) is a validated, subjective measure for acute and chronic pain. Scores are recorded by making a handwritten mark on a 10-cm line that represents a continuum between "no pain" and "worst pain." The higher the score, the worse the pain.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Acetaminophen along with a reduced quantity of Percocet

intervention.description: acetaminophen 600 mg to be taken every 8 hours (TID)
intervention.arm_group_label: Acetaminophen along with a reduced quantity of Percocet

intervention.description: Oxycodone/acetaminophen (Percocet) 5 mg/325 mg as needed for breakthrough pain for patients in Percocet+ Acetaminophen group. Percocet Group will receive standard of care Percocet 5 mg/325 mg every 6 hours PRN
intervention.arm_group_label: Acetaminophen along with a reduced quantity of Percocet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA class I-II
- Patients indicated and scheduled for arthroscopic hip surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to acetaminophen or oxycodone/acetaminophen (e.g. hypersensitivity, history of GI or bleeding disorder)
- Legally incompetent or mentally impaired (e.g. minors, Alzheimer's subjects, dementia, etc.)
- Younger than 18 years of age or older than 65
- Any patient considered a vulnerable subject
- Patients on pain medication prior to surgery

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Acetaminophen Along With a Reduced Quantity of Percocet
group.description: Acetaminophen: acetaminophen 600 mg to be taken every 8 hours (TID) Percocet: Oxycodone/acetaminophen (Percocet) 5 mg/325 mg as needed for breakthrough pain for patients in Percocet+ Acetaminophen group. Percocet Group will receive standard of care Percocet 5 mg/325 mg every 6 hours PRN

group.title: Percocet Only
group.description: Percocet: Oxycodone/acetaminophen (Percocet) 5 mg/325 mg as needed for breakthrough pain for patients in Percocet+ Acetaminophen group. Percocet Group will receive standard of care Percocet 5 mg/325 mg every 6 hours PRN

outcome.title: Score on Visual Analog Scale (VAS) of Pain
outcome.description: Pain severity scores at rest will be assessed by use of VAS. The visual analog scale (VAS) is a validated, subjective measure for acute and chronic pain. Scores are recorded by making a handwritten mark on a 10-cm line that represents a continuum between "no pain" and "worst pain." The higher the score, the worse the pain.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
